Pre-Game Insights: The Philadelphia Phillies aim to extend their three-game home winning streak against the Chicago Cubs.The Phillies are 93-64 overall and 53-26 in home games, while the Cubs are 80-77 overall and 38-41 on the road.The teams are playing for the fifth time this season, with the Phillies leading the series 3-1.Bryce Harper has been key for the Phillies with 29 home runs, 74 walks, and 86 RBI this season.Seiya Suzuki leads the Cubs with a.278 batting average, while Nico Hoerner has been contributing with 14-for-37 in the last 10 games.The Phillies have a strong record when they record at least eight hits, which could be crucial for the game.Justin Steele will pitch for the Cubs, while Tanner Banks will take the mound for the Phillies.The game is expected to be a competitive one, with the Phillies looking to maintain their home dominance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cubs have the ninth-ranked team slugging percentage in the NL at.396.The Phillies have a 68-24 record in games where they record at least eight hits.The teams' recent performances show the Phillies have been consistent, while the Cubs have been competitive on the road.Injuries for both teams could play a significant role in the game's outcome.
